questions.text: A lady has taken medication of ameiobiasis infection. In a party she drank alcohol. She has nausea vomiting and dizziness. Which anti – amoebic drug could have lead to interaction with alcohol to produce these symptoms?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Metronidazole 

• Metronidazole causes a disulfiram-like reaction with alcohol.
• This reaction inhibits aldehyde dehydrogenase → accumulation of acetaldehyde, leading to:
o Flushing
o Nausea
o Vomiting
o Dizziness
o Headache
• Other drugs like nitazoxanide, paromomycin, and diloxanide do not cause such interaction.
